item.title: [Washington Post] 'No pain, no gain' sounds tough, but you may only be hurting yourself
item.description: ‘No pain, no gain’ sounds tough, but you may only be hurting yourself While training for a half-marathon last fall, Janet Sherman, 57, started noticing pain in her right leg and left foot. A diagnosis of a quadriceps strain and plantar fasciitis led to shoe inserts and cross-training. Before long, the Wyoming-based teacher was “just good enough” to get back to training, and so she did, although she opted to drop down to a shorter 10K race distance.
